title: Self-Watering Planter
shortDescription: Create a simple self-watering planter from recycled materials.
steps: Cut the bottle in half about 4-5 inches from the bottom.
Take the top part (with the spout) and unscrew the cap. Drill or poke a few small holes in the cap.
Thread a piece of cotton string (about 6-8 inches long) through the holes in the cap, so half is inside and half outside.
Screw the cap back onto the bottle's top part.
Invert the top part and place it into the bottom part. The string should hang down into the reservoir.
Fill the top part with soil and your plant. Fill the bottom reservoir with water.
